133.unit_name: Unit 5 NATURAL WONDERS OF THE WORLD

sentences.content: Welcome back to ‘Around the World in 30 minutes’. Thanks again Sunanta for telling us about New Year celebrations in Thailand. Next we have Phong from Viet Nam. Hi Phong.
sentences.speaker: Interviewer

split_sentences.content: Welcome back to ‘Around the World in 30 minutes’.
Thanks again Sunanta for telling us about New Year celebrations in Thailand.
Next we have Phong from Viet Nam.

sentences.content: Hi.
sentences.speaker: Phong

sentences.content: Your New Year is called Tet, isn’t it?
sentences.speaker: Interviewer

split_sentences.content: Your New Year is called Tet, isn’t it?

sentences.content: That’s right.
sentences.speaker: Phong

sentences.content: The Vietnamese celebrate Tet at different times each year, don’t they?
sentences.speaker: Interviewer

split_sentences.content: The Vietnamese celebrate Tet at different times each year, don’t they?

sentences.content: Yes. This year, we will celebrate Tet at the end of January.
sentences.speaker: Phong

split_sentences.content: This year, we will celebrate Tet at the end of January.

sentences.content: What should people do to celebrate Tet?
sentences.speaker: Interviewer

split_sentences.content: What should people do to celebrate Tet?

sentences.content: A lot. It’s the busiest time of the year.
sentences.speaker: Phong

split_sentences.content: It’s the busiest time of the year.

sentences.content: What, for example?
sentences.speaker: Interviewer

sentences.content: You should make your house look beautiful at Tet so you should clean and decorate it. You should also buy flowers and plants. But you shouldn’t buy fireworks.
sentences.speaker: Phong

split_sentences.content: You should make your house look beautiful at Tet so you should clean and decorate it.
You should also buy flowers and plants.

sentences.content: Do you travel during Tet?

sentences.content: Not often. Tet is a time for family gatherings.
sentences.speaker: Phong

split_sentences.content: Tet is a time for family gatherings.

sentences.content: Yes, and … Do you eat a lot?
sentences.speaker: Interviewer

split_sentences.content: Yes, and … Do you eat a lot?

sentences.content: Yes, eating great food is the best thing about Tet! Oh, and getting lucky money. Ha ha.
sentences.speaker: Phong

split_sentences.content: Yes, eating great food is the best thing about Tet!

sentences.content: Great! Thank you, Phong. Coming up, we have Yumiko from Japan...

214.name: GETTING STARTED - 1 Listen and read.
214.title: The Central Sector of the Imperial Citadel of Thang Long

sentences.content: Hi, Dan! Have you planned your city tour?
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: Have you planned your city tour?

sentences.content: Not yet. What would you recommend?
sentences.speaker: Dan

sentences.content: Do you like to see the nightlife?
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: Do you like to see the nightlife?

sentences.content: Not really. I just want to go sightseeing around the city.
sentences.speaker: Dan

split_sentences.content: I just want to go sightseeing around the city.

sentences.content: How about visiting the Central Sector of the Imperial Citadel of Thang Long?
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: How about visiting the Central Sector of the Imperial Citadel of Thang Long?

sentences.content: What’s so special about it?
sentences.speaker: Dan

sentences.content: It’s one of the eight UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Viet Nam.
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: It’s one of the eight UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Viet Nam.

sentences.content: How exciting! What exactly is it? Tell me more about it.
sentences.speaker: Dan

sentences.content: It’s a cultural complex comprising royal palaces and monuments.
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: It’s a cultural complex comprising royal palaces and monuments.

sentences.content: Is it still intact or in ruins?
sentences.speaker: Dan

split_sentences.content: Is it still intact or in ruins?

sentences.content: Well, most of the citadel, first built during the Ly Dynasty in the 11<sup>th</sup> century and then expanded by subsequent dynasties, was demolished in the early 20<sup>th</sup> century.
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: Well, most of the citadel, first built during the Ly Dynasty in the 11<sup>th</sup> century and then expanded by subsequent dynasties, was demolished in the early 20<sup>th</sup> century.

sentences.content: What a pity! Which part of the citadel can we see now?
sentences.speaker: Dan

split_sentences.content: Which part of the citadel can we see now?

sentences.content: Well, the only structure to remain intact is the Flag Tower of Ha Noi built in 1812 during the Nguyen Dynasty. We can also see the stone dragons of Kinh Thien Palace and relics associated with many Vietnamese royal families, discovered during archaeological excavations.
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: Well, the only structure to remain intact is the Flag Tower of Ha Noi built in 1812 during the Nguyen Dynasty.
We can also see the stone dragons of Kinh Thien Palace and relics associated with many Vietnamese royal families, discovered during archaeological excavations.

sentences.content: Sounds great! When shall we go there?
sentences.speaker: Dan

sentences.content: Do you prefer a weekday or the weekend?
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: Do you prefer a weekday or the weekend?

sentences.content: The weekend suits me better. Shall we go there this Sunday?
sentences.speaker: Dan

split_sentences.content: Shall we go there this Sunday?

sentences.content: Sure. See you on Sunday morning then. I’ll pick you up at 7.
sentences.speaker: Nam

split_sentences.content: See you on Sunday morning then.

sentences.content: Thank you, Nam. I’ll wait for you.
sentences.speaker: Dan

sentences.content: You’re welcome.
sentences.speaker: Nam
